title: These beauty brands are fighting breast cancer this October
text:
October marks Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and a flurry of beauty brands are rallying around the cause.

Becca Cosmetics

Beauty brand Becca Cosmetics has come up with a new, limited-edition shade of its 'Ultimate lipstick Love' to mark Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Described as a "neutral rosy pink," the long-wearing lipstick hue has been designed to suit all skin tones, and 20% of the sales proceeds will be donated to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, through June 30, 2020.

https://www.beccacosmetics.com



Olay

Beauty buffs can do their bit with Olay's limited-edition 'Regenerist Whip Pink Ribbon Face Moisturizer,' which will see proceeds donated to the breast and ovarian health non-profit organization Bright Pink. The hydrating product also comes with a refill pod, making it a better choice for the environment, too.

https://www.olay.com



Beauty Blender

Beauty Blender is donating $20,000 to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation this month, so there has never been a better excuse to stock up on the brand's limited-edition, bubblegum pink blender, which comes in a shimmering canister.

https://beautyblender.com



Origins

Origins is supporting the cause with a 'Think Bold' limited-edition Blooming Bold Lipstick Kit comprising a 'Dusky Rose' pink lipstick and tote bag whose proceeds will be entirely donated to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, to the tune of $75,000.

https://www.origins.com



RevitaLash Cosmetics

The lash and brow company RevitaLash Cosmetics is running a Pink Promotion online, and for every one of the serums sold, the brand will donate $2 to support the City of Hope Gayle Brinkenhoff Breast Cancer Symposium.

https://www.revitalash.com
